TextView.android:text: Civil Engineering Department is the first department which started along with the inception of the college in 1958 with an intake of 60. Department was centrally aided since 1958 and it became State Govt. aided since 1966. In the Year 2014 the UG intake of the department is enhanced to 180. PG courses in environmental and structural engineering were started in 1982 and 1987 respectively. Department was recognized as research center by VTU in the year 2000. It has also been given autonomous status since 2007. Department is applying for NBA as per Washington Accord. Four research scholars have been awarded with doctoral degree. Department has got qualified and dedicated team of faculty and staff members. All the laboratories are equipped with the state of the art equipments. Department has organized number of workshops, training programmes sponsored by AICTE, ISTE, VTU, TEQUIP and ministry of home affairs. In addition to the academic and research activity the department is also serving the society by carrying out consultancy work and specialized training programmes to the people involved in the construction industry. The department is identified as State Technical Agency of PMGSY project in Karnataka State and is actively involved in the third party inspection works of roads, buildings, water supply and sanitary works entrusted by district administrations. Department has got seperate training and placement cell. Department has MOUs with several Industries and it has got a giant consultancy cell fetching about Rs. 2 lakhs per month.
Vision and Mision of the Department
=> To impart technical knowledge and skills in the civil engineering fielg to meet social, industrial, environmental and research needs at local ang global levels.
=> To provide technical education to meet the challenges in the profession through a well structured curriculum.
=> To inculcate innovative and research ideas for sustainable development with ethical values.
=> To impart effective communication and entrepreneurial skills.
=> To enhance the Industry - Institute and Institute-Alumni interaction at local and global levels.
To Provide the Knowledge of mathematics, science and engineering fundamentals for solving civil engineering problems.
To enable the graduates to conduct and interpret results of laboratory/field experiments in basic science and engineering.
To enable the graduates to exhibit their knowledge and skills of recent practices to identify and solve civil engineering problems.
To enable the graduates for pursuing higher education and lifelong learning.
To enable the graduates to acquire communication, team work and entrepreneurial skills along with the values of professional ethics.
Bachelor of Engineering in Civil Engineering
M.Tech in Engineering in Civil Engineering
M.Tech in Structural in Civil Engineering
